instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3208: What is 820-3208? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1465: What is A1465? A1465 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2924, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00164, 820-3208, 820-3435..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO SSD Detected
threads.message:
Hello I have my customer's macbook air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ( <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) and it does recognise and SSD we tried different SSD( not sure all of them working as we dont have any known good working one yet) but when we measured the socket J4501 we get all voltages as it has to be.

Only we have surprised with we read 3.3V on 1st pin of <RESISTOR>R7988</RESISTOR> as it says that there must 1.5V with no SSD plugged in. I dont know if this is normal but this is the only thing we had found weird. 

We also get 3.3V on reset line of J4501 too.

Any other advices?

Thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO SSD Detected
threads.message:
Discard first an APFS issue.
If you boot USB macOS, SSD is not recognized at all in Disk Utilities?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO SSD Detected
threads.message: Let me try that first I got what you mean

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO SSD Detected
threads.message: I have booted high sierra from usb because it didnt let me to boot monterey, but it didnt recognise the ssd in disk utilities

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO SSD Detected
threads.message:
"Only we have surprised with we read 3.3V on 1st pin of <RESISTOR>R7988</RESISTOR> as it says that there must 1.5V with no SSD plugged in"
Who said that???
There MUST be 3V always when the board is turned on.
Don't make confusion between a voltage rail and enable signal!

You may have problems with <CHIP>U4510</CHIP>, or its adjacent components.

"when we measured the socket J4501 we get all voltages as it has to be"
Including pin 24?
How are you sure about the expected values, in case you make an wrong assumption, like above mentioned?
Did you compared with good board?
